title: (x) Archer Farms Organic Cereal package - Coquette, Eagle, DIN, Steelplate Gothic {Lex, Rainer}
content:
[http://www.thedieline.com/.shared/image.html?/photos/uncategorized/2008/...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705160653/http:/www.thedieline.com/.shared/image.html?/photos/uncategorized/2008/04/10/archer_cereal.jpg "http://www.thedieline.com/.shared/image.html?/photos/uncategorized/2008/04/10/archer\_cereal.jpg")

Does anyone know the name of the typefaces applied in this package? Specially “Morning Balance with Flax”.

Glad if you know!

 [‹ (x) Looking for close match to STIMacSans - Bodega Sans {Rainer}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705160653/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44431 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bold script-like Scorch! Brolt! - Balloon {Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705160653/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44432 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cesarkohl

comments.content: It’s close to Neutraface, but the x-height seems a bit higher, some letters are slightly different, and the lowercase underneath is different.

“Organic” = Coquette  
“MORNING BALANCE WITH FLAX” = Eagle

- Lex

The black sans could be [Eagle](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705160653/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/eagle/). The lowercase below could be [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705160653/http:/www.identifont.com/show?K9) and the script looks like [Coquette](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705160653/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5PJ) by Mark Simonson.

EDIT: Argh, am too slow for Lex!

“ARCHER FARMS” is close to Steelplate Gothic.

- Lex
